page.title: 01North Petherwin
page.content: Farms predominate in this area worked for generations by single close families, tenants of two owners. A pastoral scene with Bodmin Moor to the west and in the south, Dartmoor. Daily life follows a strict pattern. The majority of farmers have two vehicles and average size families. Inner-city people are buying old properties in an effort to improve the quality of their lives. Village schools have smaller registers, supported by out county families. We are six miles from Launceston, ancient capital of Cornwall, and served only by narrow lanes. Public bus, limited to one a week on market day. North sea gas is supplied and connected by request. Connection is costly. The B3254 on the eastern side of the block carries heavy transport and public bus services.
